text: (Tap) Es hat eine bernsteinerne Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist malzig, oxidiert,mit etwas Karamell, etwas Buttersäure und leicht würzig. Der Geschmack ist würzig, aber trotzdem Geschmackslos, leicht oxidiert und leicht bitter.
On tap. Amber color, creamy foam. Aroma: malty, caramel, bread, dried fruits. Taste: malty, bread, caramel, mild hop bitterness.
On tap in Prague. Good drinkability and balance, notes of caramel, bread, low hop, bread.
U si ho příli nepamatuji, jeliko pouze doplnuji seznam ovem určitě bylo nadprůměrné - horí ne 18°, ale lepí ne 15°.

On tap, @Na Spilce Plzeň. Viaje 03/2017
Color ambarino con corona de espuma blanca, aromas tostados con notas a cafe, sabor dulce, cuerpo sedoso, floja.
Draught. Copper colour, nice frothy head that stays long. Aroma of grassy hops, some caramel. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Nothing spectacular, but I like the hoppy character.

On tap at the Kavárna Obecní dům café in Prague. Not nearly as dark as I thought polotmavies (nice plural, eh?) had to be. Kind of amber, a bit of a darker, more reddish version of gold. White head could be a touch creamier. Very faint aroma of grains and malt. Light body, super easy to drink, with sweet flavours of malt, dried fruits and grain. Just a touch grassy, but not as nearly as any of the Pilsners. Nice!
Quite good. Had it at the Plzen museum. Nice with malty rich and abundant features. Quite amber and sweet.

[Kran]
Wygląd: Bursztynowe, z wysoką pianą.
Aromat: Dość pusty, słodowy, trochę chleba.
Smak: Lekki karmel, słodycz.
Podsumowanie: Dało się wypić bez bólu, ale szału nie było.

(Keg at the hotel bar, 20160613) The beer poured brown and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts and caramel 
. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, caramel, grass, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was grassy, sweet and bitter. A tasty brew.
Klar bärnstensfärgad öl med beige skum. Doft av malt, bröd och aningen karamell. Även lättare inslag av kryddighet. Detsamma återkommer i smaken. Något för söt för min smak.
Bottle. Amber, head disappeared quickly. Aroma simple and straight forward. Little bubbles of CO2 rushing to the surface. But it all seems a bit watery after all...
On tap at restaurant Gyllene Prag, Göteborg. Clear amber with off white head. Fruity, caramel with malt and hay. Dry with medium bitterenss and medium carbonation.

Tap in Prague. Clear medium amber. Sweet brown sugar nose, touch of toast and fruity yeast. Flavor follows, tastes a bit darker than color. Minimal bitterness. Good balance. Light medium body. Solid enough. First rate in Europe.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Tap in Lucerna Hospoda, Prague. Clear amber body, light white head. Low carbonated. Aroma is very light, fruity and corn. Tastes light with tones of cereal and flowers.
Pours clear dark amber with medium white head. Aromas are malt, grass, bread, maybe some citrus. Light body, medium carbonation. Medium sweet and malty finish.
From tap. Clear dark amber color with off white head. Malty aroma, bready, caramel, herbal. Sweet and light bitter taste. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Bottle obecni dum Prague. Clear amber slight head. Toffee malt aroma taste same light hops nice sweetness. Thin body. Decent

Bottle split at LKS HeIgHtS, thanks to Fergus for doubling my Polotmavy tally in an instant, 21/04/15.
Very lightly hazed orange amber with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is bready, cereals, grain husk, light paper.
Taste comprises much the same, paper, grain, cereal, light caramel.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Blandometer is high amber.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle share, thanks to Fergus for the new style tick. Clear amber orange, lightly sparkling, small foamy off-white head, sparse lacing. Aroma is bready, rye, molasses. Body is medium, a little foamy, low carbonation. Taste has light toffee malts, warm water, soft citrus. Decent malty stuff.

21st April 2015Bottle share at Leightons Stratoflat. Clear amber beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry with mild fine carbonation. Bready malts. Traces of marmalade and floralness. Light semi dry finish. Not bad!

Bottle shared at Leightons pad. Clear honey golden coloured pour with a halo of white head. Aroma is sweet nutty, raisin, cardboard. Pretty sweet on the nose. Flavour is composed of nutty, papery, little caramel, light caramel, pretty nasty. Palate is semi sweet, moderate carbonation. Grainy, nutty, dried fruits.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Fergus. Pours clear gold with a creamy, white head. Big cereal nose, dry bread, some vague citrus. Light to medium sweet flavor with sugary cereal, slight appear, grains, ripe orange. Light bodied with average carbonation. Finishes sweet with further cereal, pale bread, hay, grain, citrus rind. OK.

How: Draught.
Where: Bar Central Vasastan, Stockholm.
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Caramel, malt, bread.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, bread, some metal.
40cl Tap. Clear amber with a white head. Mild aroma of malt. Tastes of fresh green apples, rough grass. no long finish. okay thirst quencher.

Bottle at James house for the End of History tasting. Pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Sweet grainy apple notes on the nose. Medium bodied, sweet and grainy. Not much going on. More sweetness into the finish.
Bottle. Amber color. Bready caramelly, soft floral aroma and flavor. Hints of butter and cinnamon. Decent.

Appearance: Amber, clear. Some fizzy light tan head.
Aroma: Malt, not much. Sweetness.
Taste: Malt, sweet. Pretty smooth.
Bought: Trade with Dorin - thanks!, 355 ml
Info: 22/11-2014, BB: 18/11-2014

Amber colour and almost no foam. It smells malty. The taste is sweet, malty and like caramel. Soft carbonation. Increasing sourness in the finish. Medium body and a bit oily. There is a slight bitterness in the background. Unusual style of beer, but quite drinkable.
Nettes Dunkles, das aber einen ordentlich Stich zu haben schien. Lag wahrscheinlich am weit überzogenen MHD. Ansonsten malzig, sehr malzig und ungewöhnlich sauer.

Bottle from MisoW, BBD 14/9/14. The beer pours out in a hazy amber-reddish colour with low head and medium body. Aroma of malt and graisn. Taste of rotten bread, sourness, grains, malt and herbs, combined with some hints of hops and citrus fruits. Not drinkable, due to these special slimy beards.
355ml bottle thanks to Cuso. Copper color. Thin head. Medium carbonation. Aroma is malty and herby.
Keg at u kasparu, losoviceclear mid amber with fairly sweet caramalt fruitiness. Subtle bitterness, medium body, brief finish.

Bottle shared at the End of History tasting. Not much to it. Aroma was burnt bread crust, sour pils yeast, and fugly ugly hops. Pours amber with a nice fizz to it. Taste is stale bread and skunky bohemian pilsner. Literally tastes like an old skunked Michelob. Not loving it.

On-tap: two 0.4 litre glasses around midnight on 1st Oct 2014, in a bar somewhere in Prague. Pours a good, solid amber colour with a large white head with a creamy texture. Aroma is fairly sweet with caramel and mixed fruits being the main smells. Taste is also on the sweet and fruity side with next to no bitterness until the end of each sip. Went very well with a huge Burger and chips.

Master Polotmavý 13° - CZ - Polotmavy - 5.2% - 3.5/5

On tap at Na Parkanu, Plzen. Amber color, big creamy white head. Aroma is caramel, grapes, pale and caramel malts, plum, fuity esters similar to the Leffe Rouge, brown sugar. Taste is sweetish, fruity, metallic bitterness in the finish fairly hoppy. Medium to full body, thick texture.
Bernstein color with red shine. Smell has caramel. Aroma has caramel. Taste has some light bitterness, but is a little bit thin.

Aroma of malt with some caramel notes rise from a dark amber pour. Lasting white head and volumes of lacing. The taste has a strong pilsner backbone combined with more malty notes. Medium body and medium carbonation. Overall, refreshing and very drinkable.
Bottle at End of History tasting. clear amber pour. nose is stale bread and metal. tastes also metallic, light pine, malt, bread, and like if you chew on your shirt collar. light and forgettable
UPDATED: SEP 7, 2014 Bottle thanks to Cuso. Shared at End of History tasting. Pours amber orange white head. Nose/taste of pine, grass and old bread. Medium body.
Bottle. Golden pour with tan head. Some light malty aromas. Again crappy light malt flavors.
At jtclockworks. The aroma is noble hops, corn, malt. The appearance is amber, white head the flavor is diacetyl, corn, malt. The finish is Nobel hops, corn sweetness. Not good.
Bottle @ home. Pours deep amber color, white head. Aroma is caramel, malty, bit roasted, hints of cocoa. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter, caramel, roasted malt, coffee.

W aromacie trochę słodu, trochę karmelu i nutka masełka. W smaku małe zaskoczenie bo na lekko karmelowym ciele z orzechowymi nutkami oparta jest wyraźna, przyprawowo pikantna goryczka. Nawet nieźle pijalne, ale to nic specjalnego.
Bottle from my father. Bready smell. Sweet bready taste with some caramel. Slight harsh. Light body.

Light beige bubbling head, diminishing lacings, clear amber body. Aroma; flowerbed, dust, hops, caramel, sausage, tanning, gumboot. Taste; slap hops, plums, walnuts, black syrup, fermented prunes, chili hints, dark caramel malts, whisky reek. 
Normal on palate, average carbonation.
Final with dark fruits, dried fruits, brown bread, bitter butter.
[35.5cl. brown btl. 5.3%abv l3° BB14.09.14]
Bottle.Dark copper colour with small head.Aroma of caramel and tosted malt,a bit light nuts and honey smooth with hint of spices and tosted hops,nice and mild finish.

0.33L bottle. Pours a clear amber with frothy white head that dissipates quickly. Mild but pleasant malt aromas. Honey, nut, bread. Mildy sweet up front, but quickly transitions to herby hop flavor (likely saaz). Finishes with a noteable, but still mild hop bitter that eventually grows to dominate the aftertase. Medium bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and sharp (but average) carbonation. Overall, a very quafable beer. Nice aromas and some decent hop character to balance off the malt.

0.5 litre in bottle.
Sweet malts & caramel with toasted malts & a subtle, spicy aroma. Medium strength toffee as well as some sugar & touches of vanilla.

Bottle @ home. ambrata carica, limpida, schiuma beige, non molto fine abbastanza persistente. aroma di miele, caramello, malto. Poco luppolata al naso. Amabile, caramello e miele si ritrovano anche al gusto. poco amara. poco calda, non troppo equilibrata , per via della decisa caratterizzazione di miele e caramello, satura presto con il suo gusto dolce. Armonica.

Cervesa de color coure, amb poca presència descuma, molt acaramelada.
Cerveza de color cobre, con poca presencia de espuma, muy acaramelada.

Bottle 0,355L. Clear copper colour with average big, frothy, off-white head. Aroma of toasted malts, cereals, caramel and some spices. Taste starts light bitter followed by caramel andhops and finish moderate bitter with long lasting aftertaste. Medium to full body, dry texture and soft carbonation. Not bad...

Caña en la abadía León. 02-05-2014. Color ámbar oscuro con tonos cobrizos, bastante transparente y con espuma blanca cremosa y poco persistente. Aromas de maltas tostadas ligeros. Cuerpo medio fácil de beber con poco gas. Sabores maltosos y cereales, ligeramente tostados con algo de caramelo, notas de galletas y pan. Normal, fácil de beber.

400ml on-tap in Prague Old Town (52Czk):
Sweet malts & caramel with toasted malts & a subtle, spicy aroma. Medium strength toffee as well as some sugar & touches of vanilla.

Caramel amber with a 0.25cm head that stays consistently over the opening minutes & holds as a thick lacing after that.

Slightly stronger than the nose with some caramel & toffee coming through alongside sweet malts and some spice from the hops. There is a few light, earthy hops as well & a touch of floral in there with some faint butter.

Smooth with a light-medium body & lively carbonation along with some spice. There is a good balance to the beer and it is quite sweet.

A very nice beer and definitely one worth trying if you ever come across it since it seems very hard to find outside of the Czech Republic.
amber colour, creamy beige-ish off-white head; aroma of grassy and floral hops, some fruity notes and caramel; well-balanced bittersweet taste with some fresh fruityness; correct beer

355ml bottle with a brown neck shared by Finn at a rating session in Tromsø. Decent off-white head to a clear amber body. Poor lacing. Dusty hops and caramel nose. Malty taste profile with nuts, buttery malts and caramel supported by notes of dried fruits towards the ending. Medium bodied. Too sweet for a higher score (Tromsø 19.02.2014).

Flaske 0,33l fra Albert supermarket, Praha. Delt med Rune & Charly under samling på Nerstranda 19 Feb 14. Mørk gylden. OK skum med litt lacing. Aroma av mørk frukt. Smaken har preg av aprikos. Litt tungdrikkelig.
nice beer ... my friend Frane bring this beer from Prague ..thank you rugby player ..good beer ..
0,355l Flasche. Riecht angenehm nach Brot und Caramel. Leuchtend Braun mit kleiner Schaumkrone, schmeckt nach Malz und Caramel wird im Abgang etwas Bitter.
Bottle: Amber color, off-white head. Aroma of malt with hints of caramel, hops. Flavor is also mainly malty with honey notes, a light fruitiness and a light hop bitterness.
Aroma: Bit of roasted nuts, caramel, malt Appearance: Amber brown, clear, clear white head, disappearing head, medium lace Taste: Bit of roast, mild sour, malt, slight bitter, dry finish

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je příjemné, sladové s karamelový nádechem. Pěna je spíe bílá, lehce do hněda, jemná, středně vysoká a nedrící. Barva samotného piva je měděná. Chuť má příjemný sladový střed s lehkým nádechem karamelu, fini je kávově hořký a drící. Vcelku se jedná o dobře pitelné polotmavé pivo které nezklame ale ani nepřekvapí.
Tja, det här var en rätt skön sak, för att vara en pilsner eller pilsnerliknande öl. Kroppen var lite lite men balansen fanns på plats så även om smaken var något tråkig så var det en helt okej öl.
Tack päronen för gåvan. En bra lageröl, maltig, viss sötma, litelite hint av alkoholen i smaken. Väldigt kolsyrad-

Amber color , off-white mid-sized head. Malty aroma with hint of caramel. Taste is malty with pleasant moderate bitterness and caramel. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber with off-white head. Aroma has medium sweet bread, malts, grains, earth. Flavor is sweet malt, light caramel, a bit of earth. Decent and easily drinkable.
Dark golden beer, with a light brown head. Fizzy, medium texture. Sweet with a light bitterness. Pretty malty eith bread and cough drop aromas. Not my style, but good beer.
Tap at na spilce urquell brewery, pilsen. Clear red-brown color, smooth white head. Sweet malty aroma, some fruits. Balanced sweet malty taste, some roast, little fruits and hops at the end.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with stable off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel with notes of hops and yeast. Bitter, hoppy onset, giving way to sweetish flavour of malt and caramel, ending on a slightly roasty and caramellish note. High but unobtrusive carbonation. A very nice Polotmavý.

330 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Aroma is sweet and sticky with malty bread notes, some berries and syrup. Taste is also sweet with malt, slight roastiness, some berries and hints of chocolate. Too sweet for my palate

12oz bottle from the Pilsner Urquell brewery in Plzen. Pours a clear, honey amber with some thin, white head. Nose is mild honey, mild bread, malt, some orange. Flavor is sweet, malty, cracker, cardboard, white bread, pear. Dry finish.
Bottle. Pours clear amber with decent white head that disappeared quickly. Aroma is malt, hay, caramel and something plastic. Flavor pretty similar. Carbonation is quite low.

Copper color with 1 finger off white head. Aroma of toasted, caramel, malts, straw. Taste is light sweet, quite alcoholic and a bit bitter. Light body, oily texture, lively carbonation. You can feel the ABV a lot.

Pours a nice and clear amber with an off white head.  Aromas of toffee and bread.  Very biscuit like.Very malty. Nice spicy hops - kind of german style but minus their stupid yeast flavors. Average carbonation.  I like this a lot.

On tap. Need to say the place asked for a belgian dubbel and they were given this one by the distributor...this is the kind of beer culture we have in Spain. Some malty aromas. Pours amber, a bit hazy, with nice offwhite head, creamy, vanishing. Light body, average carbonation. Taste is sweet, malty, some spicy. Lacks some more body.

Great dark gold color. 2 finger head that doesn't stick around. Not the best czech brew..pretty average beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Amber color durable white head. Not much of a nose maybe a little bit of hay, taste is very balanced  between bitter and malty . I like it, but nothing really special.

Consumed in Na Spilce, Plzen (but was it draught or from bottle?). This was the beer tasting bonus from the Plzen underground tourist tour. Aroma has malts. Taste is somewhat sweet. Looks great. I wasnt thrilled about this one.

Draught @ Prague Airport. Rated on 20.07.2009
Aroma is sweetish with malty notes, some berries and syrup. Flavour is sweet with malt, slight roastiness, some berries and hints of chocolate. Feels artifical. Actually this is quite close to Kozel Cerny 10°.

Draft in Plzeñ! Clear amber color with a pure fluffy white head and keeps a lacing until the end. Aroma is roasted malty and hints of toffee. Flavor is a little bit bitter with sweetness, quite balanced between sweetness and bitterness. Mouthfeel is long and sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone 4S

Tap at Na Spilce. Colour clear amber. Head huge creamy yellowish white. Aroma caramel malat and saaz. Taste very balanced, light hoppy bitter, light to medium honey caramel malty sweet. Nice smooth finish, saaz bitter with hints of caramel. Very drinkable,
Beer with colour of amber and with a huge head. The aroma is sweet with notes malt, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and caramel.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 355ml bottle purchased and consumed in the Czech Republic.  Clear amber body is capped by a modest but durable off-white head.  The aroma is sweet, with light and medium toasted malts and a faint herbal-spicy hop background. Has an unexpectedly rich chocolate malt flavor, with a striking chocolate note in the excellent finish. 
Palate: Creamy; excellent carbonation; medium body.

O - a super-tasty and smooth Czech amber. Highly recommended.
Bottle. ours Amber with a white head. Aroma of sweet fruity malt. Flavour is sweet caramel. Dry finish. Very nice.

33cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks! Pours deep golden with a white head. Malty aroma with caramel and hints of fruits and hops. Sweet and caramelly but well balanced. Nice, but nothing special. 
(2012-09-15)

33 cl bottle from Prague.
Golden color, ok foam .
aromas of wheat, lots of malt and dried fruits.
Medium body & complexity .
Sweetness.
Pretty ok beer

Amber pour with a huge creamy head that hangs around for a while.  Aroma of copper and caramel.  Mouth is thin.  Overall this is pretty one note but much more complex than all the Pilseners in this area of CZ.

Bottle. Amber with a rather small head. Toasted malt and Saaz hops through the nose, maybe also a subtle nuttiness. Tastewise its a really nice, toasted Czech pils - simple, solid bodied, quite bitter, with a malt and hops driven flavour. Nice one.

17/01 0.33 l bottle brought from Czech Rep. It poured dark golden, reddish hued body with medium sized head. Caramel aroma, touched with hops. Bitter flavor, dominated by grass and hay hops with sweet caramel and overripe fruit malt being there as well, giving an alcoholic feel. Medium bodied with sharp, almost unpleasant flavor, and alcoholic as well, no matter of such low ABV. Couldnt like it too much.

On tap at Na Parkanu, Plzen. Clear chestnut amber colour, fluffy white head. Aroma is light malty, sweet, caramel, some grassy hops. Flavour is sweet, malty, caramel, candy, grassy bitter finish. Light-bodied. OK.
Light brown, almost clear, nice head. Malty yet clean base. Fruity sweetness. Bock like. Good bitter backup saves this beer.
Bottle - Nice copperish in colour, Ok but not lasting foam. Some light malty nose ,taste comes with decent hops. Medium body, leaves really good bitterness in the mouth. Liked it.
The head is ok, the body is gold-brown. It smells a bit hoppy and bitter, malty. The taste is light and sweet, mild-bitter-caramel. Could be more intensive. 12/8/10/9/12/9
On tap in Plzen. A decent Czech half dark. Dark caramel in colour and taste, bitter and a little sweet. Some hints of vanilla. Malty finish. Not a bad beer, but unspectacular.
Nice and fine beer. Malty, fruity flavor, some hops, vanilla and cream. Fruity malty finish.

On tap at La Casa de la Cerveza (Madrid). Copper colour with a nice white head, medium lasting and nice lacing. Aroma is strong malty, bready and slightly caramelish. Flavour has a moderate bitterness with a good duration, strong malty as well. Carbonation is medium to high. Texture is oily.
33cl bottle. Clear, sweet malt odor, brown colour and foam is also brownish. Small bubbles, but large, bubbling foam. Sweet dream but hoppy aftertaste. A very good beer from Plzen!

Barva: jantarová, tmaví, čirá. Pěna bílá, hustá, krémová a drící. Vůně: svěí chmelová, jemná. Chuť: vyvýená středně hořká s patrnou sladovou stopou a výrazným a dlouhým chmelovým dozvukem. Plné pivo které má říz! Mírně nadstandardní polotmavé pivo.
Bottle, 33cl - Clear copper beer with a white head. Aroma is malty with notes of bread, herbs and alcohol. Flavor is malty with notes of caramel, toast, herbs and alcohol. Better than expected.

Tawny colored pour, almost a spot on copper color. Big, fluffy, white head. Plenty of lacing as it slowly falls. A biscuity malt and slight hop aroma. Big malty flavor with a slight bitterness. Some biscuit flavors as well. Not too bad.
Bottle at Bishop Arms, Skövde. Amber beer with a offwhite head. Malty, fudge, brown sugar  aroma and flavour with some hops and metallic notes.
Bottle at Bishops Arms, Skövde. Amber/deep golden beer with an ok offwhite head. Malty aroma, brown sugar, bready, toffee notes, some metal hops. Hoppy flavor, metal, brown sugar. Hoppy finish.

Bottle 33 cl, Bishops Arms Skövde, thx to Ronny. Pours clear beautiful dark copper amber with a small off white head. Aroma is caramel toasted malty fruity and a bit sour. Flavor is fruity sweet citric malty and bitter. Very drinkable and refreshing. Finishes sweet fruity and bitter.

Bottle sample at a tasting at m place. Thanks beerandbeyond. Pours dark and hazy with some foam on the sides. Smells sweet, cooked fruit. Tastes sweet and bland with a hint of bitterness. Smooth, light body and thankfully short finish.

På fat på U Bubenicku, Prag.
Bärnstensfärgad öl med klarvitt skum. Doftar karamell och gräs, alkoholen sticker i näsan av någon anledning. Smakar smörkola, sura vingummin och är tämligen vattnig. Tyvärr något trist.

Restaurace U Balbínů, Prága. Tükrös borostyán szín, közepes méretű tömör piszkosfehér hab, mely igen kitartó is. Illata kissé gyümölcsösen savanykás, karamellás és malátás. Ízében ezek mellé már kevés komló is társul. Közepesen testes, kellemesen szénsavas és száraz. Nem rossz, azonban engem ez a fanyarság kissé zavart, de azért könnyen lecsúszott.
draft.  simple and clean and mild vienna toffee malt and toasted grains with a small raisin chewiness.  a bit rough with fizzy carbonation and watery texture.  low bitterness. clean, sweet, simple.

Szép tükrös vörösarany/borostyán színben mutatkozó cseh főzet, közepes méretű sárgásfehér habképződménnyel a tetején, amely vékony fátyolként megmarad.
Illata és aromája fanyar, aszalt gyümölcsös, karamellával és a háttérben finoman munkálkodó komlóval, textúrája sima.
Közepesen száraz és viszonlag markáns befejezését citrusok, fűszerek és hajszálnyi alkoholos beütés is kíséri, amely végül egy fanyar utóízt hagy maga után.
Igen jól kiegyensúlyozott,  könnyen iható félbarna.

Bottle thanks to my collegue Anja (and her husband). Shared with Joes, best before November 10th 2011. Clear orange, no head. Smell malts, grainy. Tastes about the same. A bit flat and dull. Average carbonation, low to medium body.
Bottle at home. Clear amber pour, thin white head. Aroma is malty, with a hint of Czech hops. Flavor is watery, slightly bitter and quite clean. Simple brew.

Bottle @ home. Aroma is malty fruit, some dust, faint hop.
flavour is old beer, old fruits, some malt. Meh.

Bottle from the grocery stored in the subway station a block from my hotel.  Pours an orange brown with a thin white head.  Aroma of toasted malt, notes of nuts.  A bit funky and with light citrus.  Flavor is dry and watery.  Light sweetness.  Nutty notes and a moderate bitter hope finish.  Not bad but not great.

355 ml shared bottle.courtesy of gunnar. Pours clear deep golden with a creamy, beige film. Caramel and cany on the nose. Sweet caramel and bitter favors with toasted notes. Medium body. Smooth, leaving a dry tongue.

Draught:
Small vast white head on top of a clear orange colored beer.
Smell hops, malts, herbs, pretty fresh with fruit, orange.
Taste hops, medium bitter, caramel, malts, herbs/spices, nuts, hint of fruit, light orange, light grape fruit, light crispy and honey.
Malty herby bitter aftertaste.
Low carbo, spicy tingly mouthfeel, medium body and a light watery light creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Bottled.
Pale amber, white head. 
Malty nose, diacetyl, faint hops, hints of roasted malts. 
Off-dry, medium bodied, medium bitterness. 
Malty, buttery, notes of hops. (2011-09-02)
Shared 355 ml bottle, ABV 5.3%. Brown colour, moderate head. "Dusty" and grainy aroma, not very attractive. Dusty and grainy flavour too, hints of caramel. Boring.

Bottled from Velky Meder, SK. Clear dark amber color with with average off-white head. Sweet nose. Sweet aroma, light carbonation and medium body. Sweet and fruity tones and surprisingly bitter finish. Not bad!

Bottle @ Oase Camping, Praque. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of weak malt, some fruity hops, light peppery or spicy note. Taste is malt, grassy and sweet fruity malt. Medium, light carbonation. 310711
Bottle. Did not like this one. Overly sweet and with some strange vegtable notes.
"Half Dark" beer. It is malty to a point with an okay hop flavor. Not a bad vienna.

Bottle. Clear deep amber with a decently big bumpy dirt white head that leaves good lacings.
Sweet aroma of caramel, toasty butterscotch, some butter, a hint of apricots and very faint hoppiness.
Taste is also sweet with caramel and butterscotch, a hint of oranges, very smooth and light grassy bitterness.
Medium to light body with a smooth mouthfeel and extremely low carbonation that almost feels flat. Weird.
An ok simple märzen.

Draft @ Bishops Arms Gustav, Malmö. Pours a clear dark golden color with a small longlasting white head. Has a fruity malty grainy weak bready aroma. Fruity malty bready flavor weak hoppy hints. Has a fruity malty grainy  bready caramel finish.

Bottle sample thanks to Milos.A deep amber body crowned with a slightly off white cap. Bready nose has caramel, cereal, figs. Quite sweet with a medium bitterness that makes this fairly drinkable. Medium bodied, creamy,lengthy sweet finish.
Bottle.  Buttery toffee malt and straw aroma.  Dark amber color with moderate head and effervescence.  Lightly sweet toffee malt and moderately bitter quinine flavor.

On tap at Prague Beer festival 2011 
Aroma fresh clean aroma with slight hop in nose. Sweet malts as base.  7-
 Appearance  deep amber with proper large creamy top. Some lace is shown. 3+
Flavor and Palate : Medium full bodied. Malt oriented. I would call rather sweet. Not very complex but decently brewed.
Bottled from Jednota supermarket, Bratislava. Copper color with a medium white head. Aroma of toffee, grass, hints of caramel. taste pretty the same. Drinkable.

Prága, Tesco
Világos vörösessárga színe van, habja vékony, sárgásfehér és krémes, amiből egy vékony takaró végig megmarad. Illata igen malátás, citrusos és enyhén karamellás. Ízében is a maláta és a citrusok a döntőek, kissé fanyar és egy kevés komló. Vizes, vékony teste van és közepesen szénsavas. Utóíze is fanyar és kissé kesernyés, nem tart túl sokáig. Ez nem sikerült valami fényesen, de jól lehűtve, nagy melegben iható.

(bottle, 35.5cl) Clear, amber colour with a medium-sized off-white foamy head. Moderately sweet caramel-malty aroma with bready notes and a tinge of herbal and spicy hops. Mildly sweet and bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a crisp carbonation. Cara-malty, slightly bready taste with present herbal hops lingering into the dry-ish bitter-sweet finish. 12.V.11

Head just wasnt there and was frothy at the start, then gone! Oily, corny base to the beer. A little flowers and spice in the aroma, which I love. I was totally prepared to like this and then - bam - hit me with the chemicalness. Moderate bitterness, low-to-moderate sweetness. (Fresh, best before July 17, 2011, bottle from Wine of Dreams).
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: On tap at Na Spilce, Plzen. Pours amber with large off-white head. High carbonation. Nose; overly sweet, caramel, citrus. Taste; caramel sweetness, citrus, lemon sherbet, quite thin, soapy with a short hoppy-lemon finish. Boring and industrial tasting....

0,33 l bottle as a gift.
Clear amber colored one with a medium froathy white head. Citrussy, sourish, lemony aroma with some caramel, grassy hop. Medium-thin bodied beer with caramel, grass and lemony-sourish character.

33cl bottle in a restaurant on the Malostranska Square, Prague
Amber colour (slightly hazy).  A decent beer
Bottled. Amber color with white head. Round malty aroma. Flavor is balanced - some malty tones with hoppy notes. Good.
suprisingly nice beer from a big czech brewer. copper color, nice head, leasant taste and palate. if there is nothing else, take it.
Chutné polotmavé pivo - výborná alternativa k plzni na Masters Of Rock. Dělají i světlé a tmavé, ale tohle je nejlepčí.
light amber color, grassy, slightly caramel nose. Med body, lots of bread and caramel. Dry caramel finish.
Bottle in my hotel room in Prague. Nutty, caramel aroma. Pale amber color. Minerally, watery flavor with some caramel and a slightly dry finish. Rather useless, really.
Bevuta al Na Parkanu di Plzen e prodotta dalla SabMiller, questa "vienna" è decisamente pessima, sa soltanto di alcool

0,355l bottle, very nice caramel roasty aroma, brown, golden, clear, white foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium body, creamy, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish, very good beer...my best from SABMill CZ
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: AUG 20, 2010 
(draught 0,4l)
Light almost not detectable aroma. Clear amber color. Medium white head. Medium sweet, light caramel taste. Light sweet finish. Creamy texture. (100 beer on RB :) )
( 3 . 3 . 7 . 4 . 12 = 2.9)

(Bottle 0,355l)
Fruity, weak aroma. Clear dark golden color. Minimal white bubbly head. Light sweet. Light caramel taste. Creamy texture, light fizzy. Light bitter and some unpleasant finish. Bottle version quite disappointing.
( 5 . 2 . 5 . 3 . 9 = 2.4)

Tap @ Na Spilze, Plzen. Pours a amber / reddish with a creamy white foam and lacings. Sweet malty buiscuit and caramel nose and taste with a vague hint of butter. Smooth and chewy malty. A bit of diacetyl and grain. Nicely hopped. Nice Vienna.
on tap - outside Karlstejn Castle, poured lovely dark amber ruby color. Aroma of plums and apricot with a hint of caramel. Taste was lighter than expected and the finish was dry, not bad.

From [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ňský Prazdrojs restaurant, Na Spilce. Low, dense beige head. Beautiful, bright reddish-amber color. Moderate aroma of dryish, caramelly malts and straw-like hops. Taste is dry and fresh. Lightly toasted, slight peppery caramelly malts, with a late sourness. Mildly hopped. Crisp mouthfeel. Fresh malty ending. Good stuff.
Nový Bor, Czeck Republic, tapp in orginal glass, 10 C 20091021. Medium stong head - white colour, body: amber. Flavor apricot, hops etc , hunny, longbeska.
On tap at na parkanu in plzen. Pours a reddish brown with a white head. Aroma is candi sugar yeast caramel and malts. Flavor is caramel malts yeast, a touch of hops. Decent vienna.

On tap in Hradec Kralove. Pours deep brown with a generous creamy tan head.Strong malty caramel aroma. Taste is overwhelmed by all the malty sweetness, alcohol coming thru at the end, sweet aftertaste, not any good at all.
Sampled in Prague. A very good brew. Full of very intense malts, served in a nice glass this beer has solid creamy head. Pretty dark ambery with a plethera of malts and caramels. Pretty good brew.

Draft. An amber beer with a huge light yellow head. The aroma is sweet with notes of dust, malt, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of malt and caramel, combined with lighter notes of dust and burnt caramel, leading to a dry bitter finish.
Aroma was a tad bit roasty and a little sweet. Flavor is sweet and balanced. A little bit hoppy, but not too much. Solid.
Draught. Clear shiny amber colour. Small head. Malty flavour, slightly caramelly. The bitterness is slightly rough, but mild enough to be a good match for the caramel note.
on tap at na parkanu and at zachs pub. a pretty average vienna really, mild nutty nose, slightly citric bitterness, quite boring. this is what beer designed by a committee tastes like.
On tap. Clear deep golden with an off-white head. Sweetish, lightly caramellish nose. Medium body, sweetish caramel, flowery accents and a fairly bitter finish. 280608
Clear amber with medium off white short lasting head. Sweet malty aroma with caramel notes. Sweet flavor with caramel malt, floral and mild fruity notes. Ends mild bitter.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2012 Re-rate 3/10/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at kerenmks place. Thanks beerandbeyond. A few months past its BBD. Amber-colroed. Aroma of malt, caramel and cardboard. Sweet and stale flavor with a bit of spicy alcohol. Light to medium-bodied. Not so nice. Too old - not calculated. 4/3/3/2/6=1.8 
(6/26/08) Draught at Na Parkanu in Plzen. Clear reddish-amber. Toasted malt and some caramel in the aroma. Sweet toasty flavor, a bit bready, with some caramel. Medium-bodied. 6/4/6/3/12=3.1

(Draught) Pours copper amber. The aroma is medium malty, light fruity, light syrupy and light spicy with light hoppy notes of grass and mild resin. The flavour is of bread-like malt and grassy/spicy hops. Bit syrupy and fruity. The mouthfeel is creamy and quite clean. Medium bodied.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */’n’Grill
Thanks yespr and KimJ! Clear amber color, good off-white head. Nice herbal hoppy aroma, light maltyness. Starts malty then nice hoppyness. Some caramelly malty notes. Ok beer, but would propably prefer unfiltered version of this.
Amber with a small but lasting white head. malt dominated aroma with a touch of orange. Sweet malty flavour with caramel notes and a little fruityness. Finishes a little hoppy.

Tap @ Na Parkanu, Plzen.
Pours a beautiful, clear amber with an impressive, creamy, lightly yellowish head. Super duration with good lacing. Aroma is rather dry, has some cardboard off-flavours, but also good grassy hops and pleasant caramel. Great creamy mouthfeel, lowish carbonation. Flavour is clean and crisp, great subdued caramel notes and a good, present and obvious hops profile. Extremely drinkable.

On tap at U Salzmannu, Plzen, 500ml. Amber with cream head. Sweet malty beer with hints of malt vinegar. Also sweet and fruity and a hint of alcohol. A little pongy cooked vegetable on the nose, cabbagey. It’s ok.

Draught at Zach’s Pub, Plzen. 
Pale copper colour. Grainy, bit grassy aroma, also somewhat harsh. Solid maltiness with bit of toast and light fruity.

Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen.
Pale amber coloured, small off white head, light caramel nose. A way too sweet malty, caramelly and light fruity taste with touch of alcohol in the finish. Easy going but one dimensional beer.
Draught. Amber colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is cooked vegetavles, some sweet malts and mild hops. Flavour is very much the same along with lots of sweetness in it.

On tap at Zach’s pub, Plzen.  Beautiful amber colour.  Some ashtray, but decent malts, some sweetness.  I rather like this.  Reminds me of a session bitter.  Slight bitterness on end.  Bit of toffee.  Just this toastiness that I like.

From tap at the Marriot hotel in Plzen. Pours clear and golden deep orange to amber with a slowly diminishing light tan head. Aroma is solid breadish with a mild spice accent. Flavour starts dry and breadish, light fruity too. Turns slowly towards a more spiced and bitter flavour but not loosing the breadish dry flavours. Ends malt flavoured with a bit of sweetnes showing through.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2008 Draught at Na Parkánu, Pilsen.  Clear amber, small head. Light caramelly nose with vague notes of grass. Medium bodied with clean rounded bld mouthfeel. Raw and clumsy, simple and dull. Faint resiny finish. Very mediocre in comparison to the Pilsner Urquell Kvanicový they also serve here.

RBESG, on tap at na Parkanu, alongside (iirc) Per, Barak and Patrik.This one belonged to Per I think so a thanks goes to him. Poured an amber-red body with an off white head. Caramel and dust in the nose. Mollases?. Somewhat watery caramelly taste, chewy hops near the end but not all that big. Ok, nothing else.
Tap at the pils urquell tap place. Alround rating: Malty amber ale, easy drinking enough, but could do with less carb and alcohol.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen, Czech Republic. Clear amber color with medium rich creamy head. Fruity and slightly caramelly with some butterscotch and floral hops. Meidum bodied and smooth. Well balanced with a dry and bitter finish.

Back from a Czech Republic pub-crawl this is part of my express ratings for the typical Světlý 11°- (Czech light Pils), Světlý 12°+ (Czech Pils), Polotmavý (Czech Amber Lagers) and Tmavý (Czech Black Lagers).  Non-typical beers will receive personalized descriptions after the express ratings.-------- />
How: Tap at Na Parkanu, Pilsen, Czech Republic
The look: Clear golden copper body with a large creamy off-white head
To me a typical Czech Polotmavé (Czech Amber Lagers) is: Hay and biscuit wrapped in caramel.  Very light fruity notes with no specific fruits giving the impression of slightly fruity caramel.  Moderately sweet.  Sweetness is well balanced by dry grassy hops.  Body is smooth.  Medium carbonation.
This one: As above but a bit better put together than most.  A typical but very good example of the style.

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Na Parkanu (Plzen, Rép. Tchèque). Arôme: Odeur de caramel avec une pointe dhoublon. Apparence: La couleur est cuivrée. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréale grillée et de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est mince avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût très légèrement caramelisé. (Rating #1553)

My Bottom Line:
Expressive caramel biscuits cleanly purport ideas of refreshment and long evenings in this professionally constructed, balanced Polotmavé.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A mountain of foam establishes its kingdom atop the shiny copper translucence.
-Some wooden hop bitterness cleverly interrupts the malty reign.
-These hops only seem to appear in the last half of the sip.
-The body is healthy and the level of residual sugars maintains a pleasant middle ground.

On tap at Na Parkanu, Plzen.
draught at the kavarna in Obecni dum, Praha. Clear amber colour, medium head. Well-balanced vienna, not too sweet, not bitter but pleasantly hoppy.

On draught at U Suru in Prague. Also available diagonally across the street from U fleku. clear and copper in color with a nice thick and creamy white head. Sweet aroma with scents of toffee and caramel. A bit flat but quite smooth with a nice slightly bitter somewhat sweet caramel after taste. A bit lingering and sticky, which I love, so I am a bit impartial. One of the best beers in prague. Even comes with its own elegant napkin coaster. Better at U Suru!

On draught at Na Parkanu, Pilsen: Clear, amber coloured, mid-sized, lacy and creamy sandy head, deep caramelly nose with distinctive traces of toasted malt and spicy oaky hops, moderate sweetish-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied, slightly lingering caramelly-bitter finish. a very well quaffable, well balanced new beer........

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2008 First rating(Draught at U Mansfelda, Plzen) Clear copper color, white head. Sweet malty scent. Hoppy malty taste. Medium mouthfeel and bitterness. Pleasant hoppy aftertaste. Very beautiful and rather nice.6/5/8/3/15=3.7Rerate(Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen)On June 26, 2008)Clear copper color, tan head. Sweet malty scent. Hoppy taste. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness.6/3/6/3/12=3.0Combined rating: 6/4/7/3/13=3.3

Very light amber super clear body with a white head, super fine lacing; Simple malty sweet nose; Soft body with to little carbonation, bitter sweet simple and lacks character; Medium bitter finish a bit sweet sugary caramel malty finish. Very simple and quite drinkable.

Quite sweet, with a caramelly malt sweetness. Felt a bit flat and lifeless and definitely on the sweet side. Some bitter hos in the finish make it quite pleasant though. Quite drinkable.
Draught in Prague - a nice bar in the same street as U Fleku and Hotel Pav. Clear amber - offwhite head. Caramel, nuts, toffee, high nuts, smooth, bread & egg, light flowery hoppy. Not bad.
